channel.title: Require certain CB lvl to use a command
channel.description:
Wouldn't it be like..
Command code bla.. if (combatLevel == 3)
Something like that? Correct me if I'm wrong. (BTW the 3 is the level requirement, just used it as an example. :o)

item.title: Require certain CB lvl to use a command
item.dc:creator: @Word_Life Word Life
item.description:
@Word_Life wrote:

Thanks for your help guys but I give up even trying to code RSPS. I’m a failure at it. Even if someone were to teach me, I’d most likely not get it. No clue why I don’t understand, but I don’t.

Read full topic
item.source: Require certain CB lvl to use a command

item.title: Require certain CB lvl to use a command
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=454512.msg3328165#msg3328165 date=1283267222]

if(command.equals("testcommand1")) {
    if(combat ...) {
        sM("You must be ... combat etc.");
        return;
    }
    // Stuff goes here.
}

Obviously change the if(combat …) to what you want, such as,
if combat is higher than 10.

if(combat > 10)

if combat is lower than 10.

if(combat < 10) {

etc etc.


[/quote]
That’s returning the text string if the combat meets the requirements.

Try this format.

if(command.equals("INPUT_STRING")) { if(combat >= 50) { INPUT_STRING.getFunction(); } else { sM("You must have at least 50 combat to use this INPUT_STRING."); return; } [/quote]
I made it return so it doesn’t continue the rest of the command. Try it, it works fine.

if(command.equals("testcommand1")) {
    if(combat > 10) {
        sM("Sorry you must be lower then combat level 10 to use this command.");
        return;
    }
    sM("Great you're lower then level 10! Here's a little help to start you off..");
}

See? You just wrote exactly the same as me, just with an else statement instead.

PS; You forgot a closing brace, and also, you don’t need that return statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Require certain CB lvl to use a command
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“Word Life, post:6, topic:357998”]What if I wanted to make it so the requirement is “Greater than or Equal to?”, would I put

if (combat >= 20) {

?[/quote]
Yes

  • addition of numbers, concatenation of Strings
    += add and assign numbers, concatenate and assign Strings
  • subtraction
    -= subtract and assign
  • multiplication
    *= multiply and assign
    / division
    /= divide and assign
    % take remainder
    %= take remainder and assign
    ++ increment by one
    – decrement by one

greater than
= greater than or equal to
< less than
<= less than or equal to
! boolean NOT
!= not equal to
&& boolean AND
|| boolean OR
== boolean equals
= assignment
~ bitwise NOT
?: conditional
instanceof type checking
| bitwise OR
|= bitwise OR and assign
^ bitwise XOR
^= bitwise XOR and assign
& bitwise AND
&= bitwise AND and assign

shift bits right with sign extension
= shift bits right with sign extension and assign
<< shift bits left
<<= shift bits left and assign

unsigned bit shift right
= unsigned bit shift right and assign

Read full topic

if combat is lower than 10.

[/quote]

So generally the code I posted is right?

FUCK YEA I LEARNED SOMETHING.

K.[/quote]
